titles.title: Recognizing the importance of manufactured and modular housing in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Mr. Donnelly (IN) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 584.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Donnelly (IN) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408 - 4, 1 Present (Roll no. 297).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/25/2010--Passed House without amendment. Recognizes the importance of manufactured and modular housing to homeownership in the United States. Supports the goals and ideals of National Homeownership Month (June) and Manufactured and Modular Housing Week (the third week of June).
